headline: As health benefit costs continue to surge, Mercer’s research reveals that employers face tough decisions regarding their 2026 benefit offerings
summary: NEW YORK, July 16, 2025--Mercer, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC) and a global leader in helping clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people, today released its Survey on Health and Benefit Strategies for 2026. According to the survey, more employers will likely reduce benefits in 2026 as they try to control fast-growing health benefit costs.

According to the survey, more employers will likely reduce benefits in 2026 as they try to control fast-growing health benefit costs.
